requirement_tested: A forum homepage displaying a list of posts with titles, authors, categories, and timestamps
user_persona: A casual visitor browsing the latest discussions.
user_goal: To quickly scan the homepage and read an interesting post.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the forum website and lands on the homepage. He sees a clean list of posts with titles, authors, categories, and timestamps.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL '/'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A vertically stacked list of post previews is displayed with each showing title in bold, author username, category name, and timestamp on a ghost white background with slate gray text.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Post
narrative_steps.description: One post titled 'Best Practices for Node.js' catches Alex's attention. He clicks on the title to read more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the post title 'Best Practices for Node.js'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The browser navigates to the individual post detail page for that post.

requirement_tested: A navigation bar with links to Home, Categories, Search, and User Center
user_persona: A regular forum participant looking to explore different sections.
user_goal: Navigate efficiently between major sections of the forum.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Navigation Bar
narrative_steps.description: Jamie notices the horizontal navigation bar at the top of every page. She wants to browse categories.
narrative_steps.action: Locate and click on the 'Categories' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The browser navigates to the '/categories' URL and displays the list of available categories.

narrative_steps.title: Returning to Homepage
narrative_steps.description: After exploring categories, Jamie decides to return to the main feed.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Home' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The browser navigates back to the homepage at '/'.

requirement_tested: A search functionality allowing users to search posts by keywords in title or content
user_persona: A student researching a specific topic discussed in the forum.
user_goal: Find relevant posts about JavaScript frameworks.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Feature
narrative_steps.description: Taylor recalls reading something about React and wants to find it again. He goes to the search section.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the Search page and type 'React' into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The search box accepts text input and shows placeholder 'Search posts...' with slate gray styling.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Search Query
narrative_steps.description: Taylor presses Enter after typing his keyword.
narrative_steps.action: Press the Enter key while focused on the search input.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system calls the search API and returns a filtered list of posts matching the term 'React'.

requirement_tested: Category browsing feature showing a list of categories and ability to filter posts by selected category
user_persona: A developer interested in backend technologies.
user_goal: Browse only posts related to backend development.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Categories Page
narrative_steps.description: Jordan visits the categories page to see what topics are covered.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to '/categories'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list or grid of categories is displayed with names and descriptions on a ghost white background with slate gray components.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering by Category
narrative_steps.description: He finds the 'Backend Development' category and clicks on it to see related posts.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Backend Development' category card/list item.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to a view showing only posts tagged under 'Backend Development', fetched via the categoryPostsAPIEndpoint.

requirement_tested: Post creation form with fields for title, content (supporting rich text or markdown), and category selection
user_goal: Share a tutorial on setting up Docker containers.

narrative_steps.title: Starting New Post
narrative_steps.description: Sam logs in and decides to write a new post. He navigates to the post creation form.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a 'New Post' button or navigate directly to the post creation route.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form appears with fields for Title, Content (with rich text/markdown support), and Category dropdown, styled with slate gray borders on ghost white background.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Out Form
narrative_steps.description: Sam fills out the title as 'Docker Setup Guide', writes detailed content using markdown formatting, and selects 'DevOps' as the category.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in the title, content, and select 'DevOps' from the category dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All fields accept input correctly and reflect user choices visually.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Post
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the draft, Sam submits the post.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Submit Post' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form data is sent to POST /api/posts; upon success, Sam is redirected to the homepage or the newly created post's detail page.

requirement_tested: Individual post detail page showing full content, author info, timestamp, and associated replies
user_persona: A reader wanting to understand a complex answer.
user_goal: Read the full explanation of a solution posted by another user.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Detailed View
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks on a post link from the homepage to get the full context.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a post title from the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Navigated to the post detail page which displays the full title, author information, timestamp, and complete content with ghost white background and slate gray styling.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Replies
narrative_steps.description: Below the main content, Casey scrolls down to see how others responded.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down past the post content.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A section appears listing all replies with their content, author, and timestamp beneath the original post.

requirement_tested: Reply functionality enabling users to add comments/replies to existing posts
user_persona: A junior developer asking for clarification.
user_goal: Ask a follow-up question on a helpful post.

narrative_steps.title: Preparing Reply
narrative_steps.description: Riley finishes reading a useful post and wants to ask a clarifying question.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the post detail page and locate the 'Add a Reply' textarea.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A text area labeled 'Add a Reply' and a 'Submit Reply' button appear at the bottom of the replies section, styled consistently.

narrative_steps.title: Writing and Submitting Reply
narrative_steps.description: She types her question into the reply box and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Can you explain how this works with async/await?' into the reply textarea and click 'Submit Reply'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The reply is submitted via POST /api/posts/{postId}/replies and immediately appears at the top of the replies list without needing a refresh.

requirement_tested: User center page displaying logged-in user's profile information including username and email
user_persona: A registered user checking their account details.
user_goal: Verify that his profile information is correct.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing User Center
narrative_steps.description: Morgan logs in and navigates to the User Center to review his profile.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'User Center' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to '/user-center' where a section displays Morgan's Username and Email Address in a simple card/list format with ghost white/slate gray styling.

requirement_tested: User center section listing all posts created by the logged-in user
user_persona: A prolific contributor reviewing his work.
user_goal: Review all the posts he has written over time.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Personal Contributions
narrative_steps.description: Patricia wants to revisit her old posts. She goes to the User Center.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the User Center page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads and includes a section titled 'My Posts' showing a list of post previews she authored, matching the homepage style.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Own Post
narrative_steps.description: She clicks on one of her older posts to reread it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a post title within the 'My Posts' list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the individual post detail page for that specific post.

requirement_tested: User center section listing all replies made by the logged-in user
user_persona: An active community member tracking engagement.
user_goal: See all the replies he has contributed across the forum.

narrative_steps.title: Tracking Engagement
narrative_steps.description: Leo wants to see all his past replies. He accesses the appropriate section in the User Center.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the User Center and look for the 'My Replies' section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of Leo's replies is shown with snippets, associated post titles, and timestamps, styled with ghost white and slate gray.

narrative_steps.title: Jumping to Context
narrative_steps.description: He clicks on one of his replies to see it in context within the original thread.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a reply listed under 'My Replies'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the original post detail page, ideally scrolled to the location of that specific reply.

requirement_tested: Authentication system supporting user login and registration
user_persona: A first-time visitor ready to join the community.
user_goal: Create a new account and log in to start participating.

narrative_steps.title: Creating Account
narrative_steps.description: Dana visits the forum and wants to participate. She needs to register.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a 'Sign Up' or 'Register' option and fill out the registration form with username, email, and password.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Upon submitting valid credentials to POST /api/auth/register, Dana receives confirmation and possibly gets automatically logged in or redirected to login page.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Later, Dana returns and needs to log in with her new account.
narrative_steps.action: Enter username and password in the login form and click 'Login'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Credentials are verified via POST /api/auth/login. On success, authentication token is stored client-side and Dana is redirected to the homepage.

requirement_tested: Backend API for fetching, creating, and managing forum posts and replies
user_goal: Ensure frontend can retrieve and manipulate forum data properly.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Posts
narrative_steps.description: As part of testing, the frontend makes a request to load initial data.
narrative_steps.action: Frontend performs GET request to /api/posts.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server responds with a JSON array of posts retrieved from the PostgreSQL database using configured connection settings.

narrative_steps.title: Adding New Reply
narrative_steps.description: Testing submission of a new reply from the UI.
narrative_steps.action: Frontend sends POST request to /api/posts/{postId}/replies with reply content.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server inserts the reply into the 'replies' table and returns the newly created reply object confirming successful operation.

requirement_tested: Backend API for handling user authentication and retrieving user-specific data
user_goal: Confirm that user data is securely accessible only to authenticated users.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Protected Route Without Token
narrative_steps.description: Attempting to access user profile without being authenticated.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/users/me without providing a valid auth token.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server rejects the request with a 401 Unauthorized status due to missing or invalid authentication token.

narrative_steps.title: Successful Authenticated Request
narrative_steps.description: Now with a valid token, attempting the same request.
narrative_steps.action: Include valid JWT/session token in header and send GET request to /api/users/me.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server validates the token and returns the authenticated user's profile data retrieved from the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Connection to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables for storing posts, replies, users, and categories
user_goal: Verify that the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Application Startup
narrative_steps.description: During deployment, the backend service starts up and attempts to connect to the database.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server process.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend uses environment variables DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc., to establish a connection to the PostgreSQL instance hosting the 'myapp' database.

narrative_steps.title: Database Schema Verification
narrative_steps.description: Ensuring required tables exist and are structured correctly.
narrative_steps.action: Run a migration or startup script that checks existence of 'users', 'posts', 'replies', and 'categories' tables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All necessary tables are present with correct schemas as defined in the requirements, confirming proper database initialization.

requirement_tested: Styling with ghost white background and slate gray components applied globally
user_goal: Validate that global color scheme is applied uniformly.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Global Styles
narrative_steps.description: Ella inspects various pages to ensure consistent styling.
narrative_steps.action: Open multiple pages (homepage, categories, user center) and inspect body and component styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Body background is set to ghost white (#F8F8FF); common UI components such as buttons, inputs, cards use slate gray (#708090) for borders/text/backgrounds.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Component Consistency
narrative_steps.description: Verifying that interactive elements maintain the theme during states like hover or focus.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over buttons and links and check computed styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Interactive elements retain the global ghost white and slate gray palette even during hover/focus states, maintaining visual coherence.
